s","name":"asset","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint16","name":"hurdleRate","type":"uint16"}],"name":"setHurdleRate","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"id","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"contractAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setSingletonContract","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"treasury_","type":"address"}],"name":"setTreasury","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"events":{"AdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter contract address","asset":"The asset of the vault","vault":"The vault receiving the adapter"}},"AdapterRemoved(address,address,address)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter being kToken address"}},"AssetSupported(address)":{"params":{"asset":"The newly supported asset address"}},"HurdleRateSet(address,uint16)":{"params":{"asset":"The asset receiving the hurdle rate","hurdleRate":"The hurdle rate in basis points"}},"KTokenDeployed(address,string,string,uint8)":{"params":{"decimals_":"The kToken decimals (matches underlying)","kTokenContract":"The deployed kToken address","name_":"The kToken name","symbol_":"The kToken symbol"}},"KTokenImplementationSet(address)":{"params":{"implementation":"The new implementation address"}},"RescuedAssets(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount rescued","asset":"The rescued asset address","to":"The recipient address"}},"RescuedETH(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH rescued","asset":"The recipient address (asset field for consistency)"}},"SingletonContractSet(bytes32,address)":{"params":{"contractAddress":"The address of the registered singleton contract","id":"The unique identifier for the contract (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"}},"TreasurySet(address)":{"params":{"treasury":"The new treasury address"}},"VaultRegistered(address,address,uint8)":{"params":{"asset":"The underlying asset the vault manages","vault":"The vault contract address","vaultType":"The classification type of the vault"}},"VaultRemoved(address)":{"params":{"vault":"The vault contract address being removed"}},"VaultTargetSelectorRegistered(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"selector":"The function selector being allowed","target":"The target contract address","vault":"The vault receiving the permission"}},"VaultTargetSelectorRemoved(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"selector":"The function selector being removed","target":"The target contract address","vault":"The vault losing the permission"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"assetToKToken(address)":{"details":"Critical for minting/redemption operations. Reverts if no kToken exists.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset address"},"returns":{"_0":"The corresponding kToken address"}},"authorizeAdapterCall(address,bytes4,bytes)":{"params":{"params":"The function parameters","selector":"The function selector","target":"The target contract address"}},"contractName()":{"details":"Used for contract identification and logging purposes. The name should be consistent across all versions of the same contract type. This enables external systems and other contracts to identify the contract's purpose and role within the protocol ecosystem.","returns":{"_0":"The contract name as a string (e.g., \"kMinter\", \"kAssetRouter\", \"kRegistry\")"}},"contractVersion()":{"details":"Used for upgrade management and compatibility checking within the protocol. The version string should follow semantic versioning (e.g., \"1.0.0\") to clearly indicate major, minor, and patch updates. This enables the protocol governance and monitoring systems to track deployed versions and ensure compatibility between interacting components.","returns":{"_0":"The contract version as a string following semantic versioning (e.g., \"1.0.0\")"}},"getAdapter(address,address)":{"details":"Returns external protocol integration enabling yield strategies. Reverts if no adapter is set.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset of the vault","vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The adapter address for the vault-asset pair"}},"getAdapterParametersChecker(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter address","selector":"The function selector","target":"The target contract address"},"returns":{"_0":"The parameter checker address (address(0) if none)"}},"getAdapterTargets(address)":{"params":{"adapter":"the adapter to get the targets from"},"returns":{"targets":"an array of possible targes used by the adapter"}},"getAllAssets()":{"details":"Returns the complete whitelist of supported underlying assets.","returns":{"_0":"Array of all supported asset addresses"}},"getAllVaults()":{"details":"Returns array of all vault addresses that have been registered through registerVault(). Includes both active and inactive vaults. Used for protocol monitoring and management operations.","returns":{"_0":"Array of all registered vault addresses"}},"getContractById(bytes32)":{"details":"Reverts if contract not registered. Used for protocol contract discovery.","params":{"id":"Contract identifier (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"},"returns":{"_0":"The contract address"}},"getCoreContracts()":{"details":"Optimized getter for frequently accessed contracts. Reverts if either not set.","returns":{"kAssetRouter":"The kAssetRouter contract address","kMinter":"The kMinter contract address"}},"getHurdleRate(address)":{"details":"Returns minimum performance threshold in basis points for yield distribution. Asset must be registered to query hurdle rate.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The hurdle rate in basis points"}},"getMaxBurnPerBatch(address)":{"details":"Used to enforce redemption limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The maximum redeem amount per batch"}},"getMaxMintPerBatch(address)":{"details":"Used to enforce minting limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The maximum mint amount per batch"}},"getTargetType(address)":{"params":{"target":"The target address to check the type of"},"returns":{"_0":"type An array of allowed target addresses for the adapter"}},"getTreasury()":{"details":"Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder.","returns":{"_0":"The treasury address"}},"getVaultAssets(address)":{"details":"Most vaults manage single asset, some (like kMinter) handle multiple.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of asset addresses the vault manages"}},"getVaultByAssetAndType(address,uint8)":{"details":"Used for routing operations to the appropriate vault. Reverts if not found.","params":{"asset":"The asset address","vaultType":"The vault type classification"},"returns":{"_0":"The vault address for the asset-type pair"}},"getVaultType(address)":{"details":"Returns the VaultType enum value for routing and strategy selection.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"The vault's type classification"}},"getVaultsByAsset(address)":{"details":"Enables discovery of all vaults capable of handling an asset across different types.","params":{"asset":"Asset address to query"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of vault addresses supporting the asset"}},"grantInstitutionRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by VENDOR_ROLE. Institutions gain access to kMinter and other premium features.","params":{"institution_":"The address to grant institution privileges"}},"grantManagerRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.","params":{"manager_":"The address to grant manager privileges"}},"grantRelayerRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Relayers manage external vaults and set hurdle rates.","params":{"relayer_":"The address to grant relayer privileges"}},"grantVendorRole(address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.","params":{"vendor_":"The address to grant vendor privileges"}},"isAdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"details":"Used to validate adapter-vault relationships before operations.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address to verify","asset":"The underlying asset of the vault","vault":"The vault address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if adapter is registered for the vault"}},"isAdapterSelectorAllowed(address,address,bytes4)":{"params":{"adapter":"The adapter address","selector":"The function selector","target":"The target contract address"},"returns":{"_0":"Whether the selector is allowed"}},"isAdmin(address)":{"details":"Admin role has broad protocol management capabilities.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has ADMIN_ROLE"}},"isAsset(address)":{"details":"Used for validation before operations. Checks supportedAssets set membership.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to verify"},"returns":{"_0":"True if asset is in the protocol whitelist"}},"isEmergencyAdmin(address)":{"details":"Emergency admin can perform critical safety operations.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has EMERGENCY_ADMIN_ROLE"}},"isGuardian(address)":{"details":"Guardian acts as circuit breaker for settlement proposals.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has GUARDIAN_ROLE"}},"isInstitution(address)":{"details":"Institutions have access to privileged operations like kMinter.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has INSTITUTION_ROLE"}},"isManager(address)":{"details":"Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has MANAGER_ROLE"}},"isRelayer(address)":{"details":"Relayer manages external vault operations and hurdle rates.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has RELAYER_ROLE"}},"isVault(address)":{"details":"Used for validation before vault operations. Checks allVaults set membership.","params":{"vault":"The vault address to verify"},"returns":{"_0":"True if vault is registered"}},"isVendor(address)":{"details":"Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.","params":{"user":"The address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"True if address has VENDOR_ROLE"}},"registerAdapter(address,address,address)":{"details":"Enables yield strategy integrations through external DeFi protocols. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter contract address","asset":"The vault underlying asset","vault":"The vault address receiving the adapter"}},"registerAsset(string,string,address,bytes32,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"This function performs critical asset onboarding: (1) Validates the asset isn't already registered, (2) Adds asset to the supported set and singleton registry, (3) Deploys a new kToken contract with matching decimals, (4) Establishes bidirectional asset-kToken mapping, (5) Grants minting privileges to kMinter. The function automatically inherits decimals from the underlying asset for consistency. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to maintain protocol security and prevent unauthorized token creation.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset contract address to register","id":"The unique identifier for singleton asset storage (e.g., USDC, WBTC)","maxBurnPerBatch":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch","maxMintPerBatch":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch","name":"The name for the kToken (e.g., \"KAM USDC\")","symbol":"The symbol for the kToken (e.g., \"kUSDC\")"},"returns":{"_0":"The deployed kToken contract address"}},"registerVault(address,uint8,address)":{"details":"This function integrates vaults into the protocol by: (1) Validating the vault isn't already registered, (2) Verifying the asset is supported by the protocol, (3) Classifying the vault by type for routing, (4) Establishing vault-asset relationships for both forward and reverse lookups, (5) Setting as primary vault for the asset-type combination if it's the first registered. The vault type determines routing logic and strategy selection (DN for institutional, ALPHA/BETA for different risk profiles). Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper vault vetting and integration.","params":{"asset":"The underlying asset address this vault will manage","type_":"The vault classification type (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.) determining its role","vault":"The vault contract address to register"}},"removeAdapter(address,address,address)":{"details":"This disables a specific external protocol integration for the vault. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper risk assessment before removing yield strategies.","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address to remove","asset":"The vault underlying asset","vault":"The vault address to remove the adapter from"}},"removeVault(address)":{"details":"This function deregisters a vault, removing it from the active vault set. This operation should be used carefully as it affects routing and asset management. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper decommissioning procedures are followed. Note that this doesn't clear all vault mappings for gas efficiency.","params":{"vault":"The vault contract address to remove from the registry"}},"rescueAssets(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This function provides a recovery mechanism for assets mistakenly sent to the registry. It includes critical safety checks: (1) Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to prevent unauthorized access, (2) Cannot rescue registered protocol assets to prevent draining legitimate funds, (3) Validates amounts and balances. For ETH rescue, use address(0) as the asset parameter. The function ensures protocol integrity by preventing rescue of assets that are part of normal protocol operations.","params":{"amount_":"The amount of assets to rescue (must not exceed contract balance)","asset_":"The asset address to rescue (use address(0) for ETH)","to_":"The destination address that will receive the rescued assets"}},"setAdapterAllowedSelector(address,address,uint8,bytes4,bool)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address","isAllowed":"Whether the selector is allowed","selector":"The function selector","target":"The target contract address"}},"setAdapterParametersChecker(address,address,bytes4,address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE","params":{"adapter":"The adapter address","parametersChecker":"The parameter checker contract address (0x0 to remove)","selector":"The function selector","target":"The target contract address"}},"setAssetBatchLimits(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Helps manage liquidity and risk for high-volume assets.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to set limits for","maxBurnPerBatch_":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch","maxMintPerBatch_":"Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch"}},"setHurdleRate(address,uint16)":{"details":"Only relayer can set hurdle rates (performance thresholds). Ensures hurdle rate doesn't exceed 100%. Asset must be registered before setting hurdle rate. Sets minimum performance threshold for yield distribution.","params":{"asset":"The asset address to set hurdle rate for","hurdleRate":"The hurdle rate in basis points (100 = 1%)"}},"setSingletonContract(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Ensures single source of truth for protocol contracts.","params":{"contractAddress":"Address of the singleton contract","id":"Unique contract identifier (e.g., K_MINTER, K_ASSET_ROUTER)"}},"setTreasury(address)":{"details":"Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"treasury_":"The new treasury address"}}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"AdapterRegistered(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an adapter is registered for a vault"},"AdapterRegistered(address,bool)":{"notice":"Emitted when an adapter is registered or unregistered"},"AdapterRemoved(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an adapter is removed from a vault"},"AssetRegistered(address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an asset and its kToken are registered"},"AssetSupported(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when an asset is added to the supported set"},"HurdleRateSet(address,uint16)":{"notice":"Emitted when a hurdle rate is set for an asset"},"KTokenDeployed(address,string,string,uint8)":{"notice":"Emitted when a new assetToKToken(address).details: Critical for minting/redemption operations. Reverts if no kToken exists.

returns._0: The corresponding kToken address

contractName().details: Used for contract identification and logging purposes. The name should be consistent across all versions of the same contract type. This enables external systems and other contracts to identify the contract's purpose and role within the protocol ecosystem.

returns._0: The contract name as a string (e.g., "kMinter", "kAssetRouter", "kRegistry")

contractVersion().details: Used for upgrade management and compatibility checking within the protocol. The version string should follow semantic versioning (e.g., "1.0.0") to clearly indicate major, minor, and patch updates. This enables the protocol governance and monitoring systems to track deployed versions and ensure compatibility between interacting components.

returns._0: The contract version as a string following semantic versioning (e.g., "1.0.0")

getAdapter(address,address).details: Returns external protocol integration enabling yield strategies. Reverts if no adapter is set.

params.asset: The underlying asset of the vault

returns._0: The adapter address for the vault-asset pair
The parameter checker address (address(0) if none)

params.adapter: the adapter to get the targets from

returns.targets: an array of possible targes used by the adapter

getAllAssets().details: Returns the complete whitelist of supported underlying assets.

returns._0: Array of all supported asset addresses

getAllVaults().details: Returns array of all vault addresses that have been registered through registerVault(). Includes both active and inactive vaults. Used for protocol monitoring and management operations.

returns._0: Array of all registered vault addresses

getContractById(bytes32).details: Reverts if contract not registered. Used for protocol contract discovery.

returns._0: The contract address

getCoreContracts().details: Optimized getter for frequently accessed contracts. Reverts if either not set.

getHurdleRate(address).details: Returns minimum performance threshold in basis points for yield distribution. Asset must be registered to query hurdle rate.

returns._0: The hurdle rate in basis points

getMaxBurnPerBatch(address).details: Used to enforce redemption limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.

returns._0: The maximum redeem amount per batch

getMaxMintPerBatch(address).details: Used to enforce minting limits for liquidity and risk management. Reverts if asset not registered.

returns._0: The maximum mint amount per batch

params.target: The target address to check the type of

returns._0: type An array of allowed target addresses for the adapter

getTreasury().details: Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder.

returns._0: The treasury address

getVaultAssets(address).details: Most vaults manage single asset, some (like kMinter) handle multiple.

returns._0: Array of asset addresses the vault manages

getVaultByAssetAndType(address,uint8).details: Used for routing operations to the appropriate vault. Reverts if not found.

returns._0: The vault address for the asset-type pair

getVaultType(address).details: Returns the VaultType enum value for routing and strategy selection.

returns._0: The vault's type classification

getVaultsByAsset(address).details: Enables discovery of all vaults capable of handling an asset across different types.

returns._0: Array of vault addresses supporting the asset

grantInstitutionRole(address).details: Only callable by VENDOR_ROLE. Institutions gain access to kMinter and other premium features.

params.institution_: The address to grant institution privileges

grantManagerRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.

params.manager_: The address to grant manager privileges

grantRelayerRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Relayers manage external vaults and set hurdle rates.

params.relayer_: The address to grant relayer privileges

grantVendorRole(address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.

params.vendor_: The address to grant vendor privileges

isAdapterRegistered(address,address,addr.details: Used to validate adapter-vault relationships before operations.

params.asset: The underlying asset of the vault

returns._0: True if adapter is registered for the vault
Whether the selector is allowed

isAdmin(address).details: Admin role has broad protocol management capabilities.

returns._0: True if address has ADMIN_ROLE

isAsset(address).details: Used for validation before operations. Checks supportedAssets set membership.

returns._0: True if asset is in the protocol whitelist

isEmergencyAdmin(address).details: Emergency admin can perform critical safety operations.

returns._0: True if address has EMERGENCY_ADMIN_ROLE

isGuardian(address).details: Guardian acts as circuit breaker for settlement proposals.

returns._0: True if address has GUARDIAN_ROLE

isInstitution(address).details: Institutions have access to privileged operations like kMinter.

returns._0: True if address has INSTITUTION_ROLE

isManager(address).details: Managers can execute calls in the vault adapter.

returns._0: True if address has MANAGER_ROLE

isRelayer(address).details: Relayer manages external vault operations and hurdle rates.

returns._0: True if address has RELAYER_ROLE

isVault(address).details: Used for validation before vault operations. Checks allVaults set membership.

returns._0: True if vault is registered

isVendor(address).details: Vendors can grant institution roles and manage vendor vaults.

returns._0: True if address has VENDOR_ROLE

registerAdapter(address,address,address).details: Enables yield strategy integrations through external DeFi protocols. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.

params.vault: The vault address receiving the adapter

registerAsset(string,string,address,byte.details: This function performs critical asset onboarding: (1) Validates the asset isn't already registered, (2) Adds asset to the supported set and singleton registry, (3) Deploys a new kToken contract with matching decimals, (4) Establishes bidirectional asset-kToken mapping, (5) Grants minting privileges to kMinter. The function automatically inherits decimals from the underlying asset for consistency. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to maintain protocol security and prevent unauthorized token creation.

params.asset: The underlying asset contract address to register
params.id: The unique identifier for singleton asset storage (e.g., USDC, WBTC)
params.maxBurnPerBatch: Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch
params.maxMintPerBatch: Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch
params.name: The name for the kToken (e.g., "KAM USDC")

returns._0: The deployed kToken contract address

registerVault(address,uint8,address).details: This function integrates vaults into the protocol by: (1) Validating the vault isn't already registered, (2) Verifying the asset is supported by the protocol, (3) Classifying the vault by type for routing, (4) Establishing vault-asset relationships for both forward and reverse lookups, (5) Setting as primary vault for the asset-type combination if it's the first registered. The vault type determines routing logic and strategy selection (DN for institutional, ALPHA/BETA for different risk profiles). Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper vault vetting and integration.

params.asset: The underlying asset address this vault will manage
params.type_: The vault classification type (DN, ALPHA, BETA, etc.) determining its role
params.vault: The vault contract address to register

removeAdapter(address,address,address).details: This disables a specific external protocol integration for the vault. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper risk assessment before removing yield strategies.

params.vault: The vault address to remove the adapter from

removeVault(address).details: This function deregisters a vault, removing it from the active vault set. This operation should be used carefully as it affects routing and asset management. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to ensure proper decommissioning procedures are followed. Note that this doesn't clear all vault mappings for gas efficiency.

params.vault: The vault contract address to remove from the registry

rescueAssets(address,address,uint256).details: This function provides a recovery mechanism for assets mistakenly sent to the registry. It includes critical safety checks: (1) Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE to prevent unauthorized access, (2) Cannot rescue registered protocol assets to prevent draining legitimate funds, (3) Validates amounts and balances. For ETH rescue, use address(0) as the asset parameter. The function ensures protocol integrity by preventing rescue of assets that are part of normal protocol operations.

params.amount_: The amount of assets to rescue (must not exceed contract balance)
params.asset_: The asset address to rescue (use address(0) for ETH)
params.to_: The destination address that will receive the rescued assets

params.parametersChecker: The parameter checker contract address (0x0 to remove)

setAssetBatchLimits(address,uint256,uint.details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Helps manage liquidity and risk for high-volume assets.

params.asset: The asset address to set limits for
params.maxBurnPerBatch_: Maximum amount of the asset that can be redeemed in a single batch
params.maxMintPerBatch_: Maximum amount of the asset that can be minted in a single batch

setHurdleRate(address,uint16).details: Only relayer can set hurdle rates (performance thresholds). Ensures hurdle rate doesn't exceed 100%. Asset must be registered before setting hurdle rate. Sets minimum performance threshold for yield distribution.

params.asset: The asset address to set hurdle rate for
params.hurdleRate: The hurdle rate in basis points (100 = 1%)

setSingletonContract(bytes32,address).details: Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE. Ensures single source of truth for protocol contracts.

setTreasury(address).details: Treasury receives protocol fees and serves as emergency fund holder. Only callable by ADMIN_ROLE.
